wikipedia_page.main: Charles Philip Leese (22 May 1889 – 19 January 1947) was an English cricketer active from 1908 to 1911 who played for Lancashire. He was born in Manchester and died in Shropshire. He appeared in 16 first-class matches as a righthanded batsman, scoring 341 runs with a highest score of 48 and held five catches.Leese married Ethel Speakman, but they divorced, and she later married architect Maxwell Fry.

response: In 1926 he married his first wife Ethel Leese (née Speakman). She was a divorcee, previously married to Lancashire cricketer Charles Leese (1889–1947),GRO ref. 1911 Sep, Prestwich 8d 795 and aged 38 when they married.GRO ref. 1926 Jun, Chelsea 01a 902 The marriage was not happy: Max described her as "a too well-bred wife without a frolic in her nature ... with the same determination [as her mother] to be well thought of without trying", and he also noted that she was a chain smoker.Autobiographical Sketches, p.130 They had one daughter, Ann Fry.
